definition: to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: In northern Kenya, scores die every year in clashes over watering holes and cattle.
sentences.chinese: 在肯尼亞北部，每年死於得分超過澆水洞和牛的衝突。

sentences.english: There is a water - retaining layer at the bottom of the flower trough which reduces irrigation.
sentences.chinese: 花槽底部有蓄水層，可減少澆水次數。

sentences.english: Carried water to them for a solid summer.
sentences.chinese: 整整一個夏天我都堅持爲它們澆水。

sentences.english: I went out to water the geraniums.
Should the flowers be watered often?
Thmight means You don't need to wdined onr the garden.
sentences.chinese: 這就是就是說，你不用給花園澆水了。

sentences.english: Allow the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
sentences.chinese: 土壤稍微乾透後再次澆水。

sentences.english: Keep your tree watered but don't let the soil be so moist that it ever looks like mud.
sentences.chinese: 你只樹澆水但是別讓土壤潮溼，它可以讓越來越像泥。

sentences.english: Peter waters the garden in the morning.
Xiao gang full head big sweat from the river to play water to help young trees watered.
sentences.chinese: 小剛滿頭大汗的從小河邊打來水幫小樹澆水。

sentences.english: Do not water the bearded iris.
He could be doused in water but it had to be potable.
sentences.chinese: 他能夠被他可以被澆水，但必須是可飲用的水。

sentences.english: He looked down at his roses, and went on watering them.
sentences.chinese: 他低頭看着他的玫瑰花，繼續給它們澆水。

sentences.english: That rose will revive if you water it.
sentences.chinese: 只要你澆水，那玫瑰就又會活過來。

sentences.english: She waters the tulips every morning.
sentences.chinese: 她每天早晨都給鬱金香澆水。

sentences.english: This machine provides two alternative ways of drain or watering: auto and manual.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種用於花草樹木的自動澆水機。

definition: to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
